name: OxBow School of Arts and Artists
funding: Fully or partially funded
facilities: Painting, ceramics, glass, metals, printmaking studios
requirements: CV, bio, artist statement, proposal

name: The Steel Yard
facilities: Blacksmithing, welding, metalsmithing studios
funding: Partial funding/workshare options
requirements: CV, ten digital images, narrative statement

name: Bemis Center for Contemporary Arts
funding: $1,250 monthly stipend + $750 travel stipend
facilities: Project spaces, sound studio, research library
requirements: CV, professional experience, $40 application fee

name: Yaddo
funding: No fee to attend; access to grants
facilities: Private studios, accommodations, library, dining

name: Saguaro National Park Artist Residency

name: Pilotenkueche
facilities: Studio space, networking opportunities, public presentations

name: The Studios at MASS MoCA Residency
facilities: Printmaking studio, weaving looms, darkroom
requirements: Artist introduction, work samples, bio/CV, residency goals

name: Alaska AIR - Bunnell Street Arts Center
funding: $2,000 artist stipend, $1,000 travel stipend, $250 material stipend
facilities: Shared studios, exhibition space, housing at Old Town Bed & Breakfast

name: Chautauqua Residency
facilities: Individual studio spaces, communal resources, lectures
funding: Financial aid available

name: NXTHVN
facilities: Studio provided, exhibition opportunities

facilities: Ceramics, metal, shared spaces, workshops

facilities: Etching, relief, lithography, screen printing

facilities: Shared studio, practice space, grand piano

name: Artists’ Cooperative Residency & Exhibitions (ACRE)
facilities: Communal workspaces, screen-printing studio, sound studio, fibers studio

name: Allerton Park and Retreat Center
funding: $1,200 stipend
facilities: Private lodging, indoor studio, outdoor space

name: Taleamor Park
facilities: Shared residence, common rooms, kitchen

name: A.I.R. Studio Paducah
facilities: Apartment with kitchen, utilities included

name: Glen Arbor Arts Center
facilities: Rustic seasonal studio, housing provided

name: T.C. Steele Historic Site

name: PLYSPACE
funding: Stipends ranging from $500 to $1,500
facilities: Living space, workspace, partner organization workspace

name: Light Work
funding: $5,000 stipend
facilities: Furnished apartment, darkroom, digital equipment

name: Bighorn Canyon National Park
facilities: Housing or campsite, natural and cultural inspiration
requirements: Resume, letter of intent, reference, photos of work

name: South Carolina State Parks Artist Residency
facilities: Cabin with kitchen, utilities, basic supplies
cost: $25 application fee, provide a finished work within 90 days

name: Wildacres Retreat
facilities: Cabin, lapidary and ceramics workshops, outdoor spaces

Opportunity Name: Chaos Code 2025 New York International Art Competition

Location: University of North Carolina at Charlotte

Notes: If accepted as a speaker, full registration is free

Location: Cologne, Germany and multiple showcase locations

Price or Pay: $20 for 1 entry, $40 for up to 4 entries, $5 for additional entries.

Notes: $1800 grant, honorable mentions available as well
One-week residency: $525–$725 (sliding scale), Two-week residency: $1,000–$1,350 (sliding scale).
Applicants must be at least 21 years of age and not enrolled in a degree program at the time the residency would occur.

Location: Washington Square Park, New York City, New York
Notes: Open to teaching artists residing in New York City or within reliable commuting distance.

Institution Name: New York Foundation for the Arts

name: Kriti Gallery and Residency
funding: free

name: Lighthouse Works
funding: well funded fellowship
requirements: Artist Talk and Open Studio

name: MANIFEST ARTIST RESIDENCY
funding: Free 24/7 use of a private studio consisting of (for one artist) approximately five hundred square feet of studio and display space for a period of one year (including nominal utilities).
requirements: $50 Submission Fee, 12 Images

name: LATITUDE CHICAGO
funding: $1,000 ink stipend, unlimited scanning, a personal workstation, training and guidance by our staff, an organized public event to present their new work, and lifetime free lab access.
requirements: General Artist Information (Name, Email, Phone Number), Artist Bio (200-word limit), Artist Statement (200-word limit), Submission of 10 JPEG images of your work., Lab Proposal (500 word limit), Programming Proposal (500-word limit), Professional References (2 references we can contact for recommendation if you are selected as a finalist)

name: WAVE POOL
funding: $2000 stipend for the project (which includes living/travel expenses)
requirements: engage the community in at least one public workshop, program, or performance during their stay.

name: Hambidge Center
funding: $300/ week, BUT Hambidge offers funding which removes the fees for a two-week residency and provide a $700 stipend, $30 app fee
deadline: January 15 for Summer, April 15 for the Fall, September 15 for the Spring of the following year
requirements: Proposal, Bio, CV, work samples (variable by medium)

name: Haystack Mountain School of Craft – Open Studio Residency
funding: No cost, no application fee – artist responsible for travel and materials
requirements: Slideroom application with 4 images of work

name: John Michael Kohler Art Center
funding: No cost, $160/week stipend and industrial materials provided
requirements: Artist statement, Statement of interest, Statement of experience, 10 images, 2 references

name: The Baltimore Jewelry Center
funding: $500 stipend
requirements: Be willing to log a minimum 20 hours of studio time and 5 hours of volunteer time per week and do weekly check ins

name: The Steel Yard
duration: long term and short-term residencies available
funding: Free of cost, all access to 10,000 square foot studio/tools/resources, paid fellowships available
requirements: CV, 10 images, artist bio, narrative statement, and 1 reference

name: KALA Art Institute
disciplinary_restrictions: Printmaking, Sculpture, Ceramics, Textiles, Photography, Digital Art

name: Penland School of Craft
disciplinary_restrictions: Books, Ceramics, Painting, Glass, Letterpress, Metalsmithing, Papermaking, Photography, Printmaking, and Textiles.

name: RAIR
funding: $1000 stipend, travel and housing reimbursements are available to artists outside the region, a modest project budget is made available for projects that require additional support.
deadline: August 1 until September 30th for the next year
requirements: 10 work samples, Project proposal (max 500 words), References: 3 names and contact information of people who can speak to the rigor of your work, Resume/CV, $25 fee

name: The Cornish Center for Cartoon Studies Residency Fellowship
funding: $3,000 honorarium
requirements: Must have valid driver’s license, residency exists 20 minute drive away from the Cornish Center for Cartoon Studies, Description of project, Samples specific to the proposed project, Samples of work or portfolio, References

name: NEF Animation International Artist Residency
funding: Euros 1,200 or ~$1,400, traveling expenses are reimbursed
deadline: March 9 for residencies in October of the same year or April of the next year
requirements: Authors can apply with any personal projects of short, medium or full length animated films. Projects of animated film in new or hybrid formats (artistic installation, virtual reality, transmedia, video-mapping, TV series or TV special, animated documentary, etc.) are also accepted., Cover Letter, Presentation of Project, CV, some visual elements and graphic research, Portfolio of previous work/films

name: RTPI Artist in Residence
funding: $1000 honorarium, Housing, per diem, travel reimbursement
requirements: Interest/inspo from RTP, birds, nature, Proposal for residency project (themes/topics to research, and potential artworks), Images of work indicative of current practice

name: Watershed Salad Days Artist Residency
funding: Housing (private room), Meals and/or meal stipend, Large, dedicated studio space, Free materials & firings, $4,000 stipend, Accommodations & meals during Salad Days
requirements: Questions @ experience & interest in the role, Proposed design for the plates/bowls, including written description and visual prototype, Images of work
